image.altText: A sign at the Women's and Children's Hospital in North Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Surgical equipment which was compromised when humidity in a storage room rose above threshold levels put 38 Women's and Children's Hospital patients at "low risk", the hospital's management has revealed.

title.children: Patients at risk after surgical equipment compromised by humidity

image.altText: An elderly man in a jumper smiles for a family photo

props.synopsis: An inquest has heard an elderly man who died after driving on the wrong side of a highway in 2019 was pulled over by police weeks earlier. The officer says he believes the man was "incapable of driving on the road at the time", but could not stop him from driving.

title.children: Police had no power to remove licence from elderly man before fatal crash, inquest told

image.altText: An aerial photo of a large industrial work site in Port Pirie.

props.synopsis: Plans for a $750 million green hydrogen facility at Port Pirie, which was initially announced in 2021, have been shelved, the state government says.

title.children: Green hydrogen project at Port Pirie smelter shelved

image.altText: A man standing on a beach holding a dead cuttlefish in his right hand

props.synopsis: A microalgae "toxic to fish but not humans" has been identified as the cause of a bloom linked to octopus and other marine deaths along SA beaches, with environment authorities saying the algae has flourished "marine heatwave" and "warmer-than-usual" sea temperatures.

title.children: Toxic microalgae identified as cause of bloom linked to marine deaths

image.altText: Two men in white shirts and black ties smiling with an arm around each other in a supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: As rising costs and shrinking margins continue to hit independent grocers, competing with Coles and Woolworths is getting tougher. But that is not stopping them from trying.Â

title.children: Independent to open 69th store in face-off with big supermarkets

image.altText: Disability Rights Advocacy Service wide shot

props.synopsis: One of the state's largest disability advocacy services has gone into administration and an "urgent assessment of its operations and financial position" is underway.Â

title.children: Disability advocacy service in administration as 'urgent' assessment underway

image.altText: A young girl lying on a bed with a nasal canula placed

props.synopsis: The parents of South Australian twin girls with conditions that mean they regularly need resuscitating vow to fight an NDIA decision to refuse a request for more support from registered nurses.

title.children: Girls with rare genetic conditions kept from school after funding rejection

image.altText: Small woman, with footy in beanie second from left with girls in black and gold team guernseys, shorts sitting, laughing

props.synopsis: Doing the washing is no chore for Linda Robinson and it has taken her onto the sports field in support of a women's footy team that has made the local Australian Rules grand final.

title.children: Woman's laundry obsession adds shine to footy team's stellar season

image.altText: Police move search for Joanne Ratcliffe and Kirste Gordan

props.synopsis: A new private search will begin in the state's Mid North for Joanne Ratcliffe and Kirste Gordon, who went missing from Adelaide Oval more than 50 years ago.

title.children: Renewed SA search for children who went missing more than 50 years ago

image.altText: A pink bunny rabbit child's toy sitting on the ground with other toys blurred in the background.

props.synopsis: The SA government says it "cannot commit" to stamping out a practice that enables child protection authorities to formally "close" cases of suspected abuse or neglect because there aren't enough staff to investigate them.

title.children: SA government 'cannot commit' to baby death inquest recommendation

image.altText: Jim Chalmers reads the budget book in his office.

props.synopsis: With an expected decade of deficits on the horizon, Treasurer Jim Chalmers will try to convince voters that today's federal budget manages to balance the need to keep a lid on spending while giving struggling households enough support.Â

title.children: Staring down years of deficits, Chalmers spruiks budget as a 'platform for prosperity'

image.altText: Three people on an outback track near Oodnadatta.

props.synopsis: Four people who were stranded in South Australia's outback have been rescued after a "significant search" in the state's far north, where heavy rain has closed roads.

title.children: Group stranded in SA outback rescued after heavy rain closes roads

image.altText: Black and white photo of man and woman walking through floodwaters up to shins carrying equipment.

props.synopsis: The Royal Flying Doctor Service hopes an exhibition in Broken Hill will keep the organisation alive and draw more tourists to the outback city.

title.children: Untold stories about flying doctors' early days revealed

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Samsung Electronics' co-CEO dies of cardiac arrest, with no successor named, while Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD posts a larger annual revenue than Tesla. Look back on the day's financial news and insights from our specialist business reporters.

title.children: Samsung co-CEO dies, Chinese EV maker surpasses Tesla's annual revenue â as it happened

image.altText: A blindfolded man is loaded into the back of a van at night time

props.synopsis: A documentary maker is among three Palestinians beaten and detained in the West Bank, according to a co-director who says he witnessed the arrest.Â

title.children: Oscar-winning director beaten by Israeli settlers, witnesses say

image.altText: An anonymous woman silouhette, with her looking onto a busy street in Kings Cross, with people walking by, blurred.

props.synopsis: An American man filmed women in Sydney's east with recording glasses and posted the footage to social media without the women's consent.Â

title.children: 'Soul-destroying': Sydney women secretly filmed by man with camera in glasses

image.altText: The 23andMe logo seen on a smartphone

props.synopsis: The genomic testing company says the way it stores data hasn't changed and any new buyers would have to follow the "applicable law" about security.Â

title.children: What does 23andMe's collapse mean for customers' data?

image.altText: Building with people walking in front

props.synopsis: The University of Wollongong will cut up to 10 per cent of its non-academic staff in its latest round of redundancies, which it claims is a consequence of changes to international student visa processing.

title.children: University cuts up to 180 more jobs amid student visa changes

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: Parenting experts and psychologists say we should be talking with our teenagers about the themes raised in the crime drama.

title.children: Netflix's Adolescence raises tough questions for parents. Let's unpack them

image.altText: A mob of sheep in a yard.

props.synopsis: Scientists call for the federal government to invest more in preventing the disease from spreading to Australia's $5 billion sheep meat industry.

title.children: Australia on alert after UK detects world's first case of bird flu in sheep

image.altText: A hole is seen in a wall at Gaza's Nasser Hospital after the strike

props.synopsis: The director of Gaza's Nasser Hospital says there was already a shortage of oxygen after an earlier Israeli strike.

title.children: Nasser Hospital strike survivor saw friend 'flying' through the air

image.altText: Man using Facebook with a ban symbol

props.synopsis: Facebook users in Papua New Guinea remain offline after the government carried out what it described as "testing" to regulate hate speech and offensive content.

title.children: Facebook shut down in PNG in 'test' to stop 'pornography, misinformation'

image.altText: A close-up of Basil Zempilas wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: After winning his seat by an extremely thin margin, newly minted Churchlands MP Basil Zempilas is voted in by his party colleagues as leader of the WA Liberals.

title.children: Newly minted MP Basil Zempilas voted in unopposed as WA Liberal leader

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A wrecked yellow panel van sits in bushland near Collie, believed to be at the centre of the Lisa Mott disappearance.

props.synopsis: Police investigating the suspected murder of 12-year-old Lisa Mott in the WA town of Collie in 1980 appeal for help as they try to identify the owner of a yellow panel van previously found dumped in bushland.

title.children: Abandoned panel van could hold clues to teen's disappearance 44 years ago

image.altText: A crashed plane lies on sand is fenced off as emergency services work around it.

props.synopsis: A pilot who died in a plane crash at Jandakot Airport last year was likely distracted by a loose engine cover, a report finds.Â

title.children: Pilot who died after plane crash likely distracted by flapping engine cover

image.altText: Supermarket worker stands in front of the lettuce section.

props.synopsis: Some farmers say the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission report hasn't gone far enough, with more transparency wanted between supermarkets and shoppers. Others are happy to see changes made to the way they do business with Coles, Aldi and Woolworths.Â

title.children: Frustrated fruit grower wants supermarkets to display what they pay farmers

image.altText: A man looks on during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: For 15 years, Daly Cherry-Evans has been Manly's guiding star. Now, with the Sea Eagles legend set to exit the club, both Cherry-Evans and the Silvertails are off the edge of the map for the first time in an age.Â

title.children: It's taken a generation but Manly and Cherry-Evans must face the unknown

image.altText: Saturn backlit by the Sun showing its various rings in different colours.

props.synopsis: Planets don't get much more iconic than Saturn. But if you managed to see it through a backyard telescope right now, you wouldn't see its rings.

title.children: Why have Saturn's rings disappeared from view?

image.altText: Danny Nikolic wearing a brown long sleeve leaning against a street pole

props.synopsis: Former champion jockey Danny Nikolic and lawyer Patrick Lennon have appeared before the Melbourne Magistrates' Court after allegedly attempting to steal luxury items valued at $177,000.Â

title.children: Jewellery, Toyota Hilux among items champion jockey allegedly attempted to steal

image.altText: Gerard Depardieu arrives in court dressed in black

props.synopsis: Prosecutors allege the assaults against two women - whose full identities have not been revealed - took place during the filming in 2021 of "Les Volets Verts" (The Green Shutters).

title.children: French actor Gerard Depardieu goes on trial for sexual assault

image.altText: A smirking man wearing a brown shirt takes a selfie shot.

props.synopsis: A man who sexually assaulted a seven-year-old girl in an act of "significant violence" after breaking into her Perth home is sentenced to 18 years in prison.

title.children: 'A lifetime of pain': Home invader jailed after sexually assaulting 7yo girl

image.altText: Sadia Sulaiman carries a blue polio vaccine esky.

props.synopsis: Pakistan is one of only two countries where polio remains endemic and it is aiming to eradicate it by 2027, but with cases soaring last year, experts and officials worry it will miss its goal. Â

title.children: How the CIA inadvertently caused fear of the polio vaccine in Pakistan

image.altText: Comedian Sashi Perera and her husband Charlie embrance on the dance floor of their post-elopement party.

props.synopsis: When my husband and I eloped in 2020, we promised ourselves that we'd have a big party later. After the pandemic, miscarriages and my father's death, it was time to manufacture some joy. Â

title.children: Our newlywed years were grief-filled, so we threw a 'not wedding' party
